titleStmt.title: The discovery of Nevv Brittaine began August 27, Anno Dom. 1650 / by Edward Bland, merchant, Abraham Woode, captaine, Sackford Brewster, Elias Pennant, gentlemen from Fort Henry, at the head of Appamattuck River in Virginia, to the fals of Blandina, first river in New Brittaine, which runneth west, being 120. mile south-west, between 35. & 37. degrees (a pleasant country) of temperate ayre and fertile soyle.
titleStmt.author: Bland, Edward, d. 1653.
Woode, Abraham.
Brewster, Sackford.
Pennant, Elias.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Harper for John Stephenson ...,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in Library of Congress.
